speaker: MERCUTIO
text:
Where
               
              the
               
              devil
               
              should
               
              this
               
              Romeo
               
              be
              ?

text:
Came
               
              he
               
              not
               
              home
               
              tonight
              ?

text:
Not
               
              to
               
              his
               
              father’s
              .
               
              I
               
              spoke
               
              with
               
              his
               
              man
              .

Why
              ,
               
              that
               
              same
               
              pale
               
              hard-hearted
               
              wench
              ,
               
              that
               
              Rosaline
              ,

speaker: MERCUTIO
text:
Torments
               
              him
               
              so
               
              that
               
              he
               
              will
               
              sure
               
              run
               
              mad
              .

speaker: BENVOLIO
text:
Tybalt
              ,
               
              the
               
              kinsman
               
              to
               
              old
               
              Capulet
              ,

speaker: BENVOLIO
text:
Hath
               
              sent
               
              a
               
              letter
               
              to
               
              his
               
              father’s
               
              house
              .

speaker: MERCUTIO
text: A challenge, on my life.

speaker: BENVOLIO
text: Romeo will answer it.

speaker: MERCUTIO
text: Any man that can write may answer a letter.

speaker: BENVOLIO
text: Nay, he will answer the letter’s master, how

speaker: BENVOLIO
text: he dares, being dared.

speaker: MERCUTIO
text: Alas, poor Romeo, he is already dead,

speaker: MERCUTIO
text: stabbed with a white wench’s black eye, run

speaker: MERCUTIO
text: through the ear with a love-song, the very pin of his

speaker: MERCUTIO
text: heart cleft with the blind bow-boy’s butt shaft. And

speaker: MERCUTIO
text: is he a man to encounter Tybalt?

speaker: BENVOLIO
text: Why, what is Tybalt?

speaker: MERCUTIO
text: More than prince of cats. O, he’s the courageous

speaker: MERCUTIO
text: captain of compliments. He fights as you sing

speaker: MERCUTIO
text: prick-song, keeps time, distance, and proportion.

speaker: MERCUTIO
text: He rests his minim rests, one, two, and the third in

speaker: MERCUTIO
text: your bosom—the very butcher of a silk button, a

speaker: MERCUTIO
text: duelist, a duelist, a gentleman of the very first house

speaker: MERCUTIO
text: of the first and second cause. Ah, the immortal

speaker: MERCUTIO
text: passado, the punto reverso, the hay!

speaker: BENVOLIO
text: The what?

speaker: MERCUTIO
text: The pox of such antic, lisping, affecting

speaker: MERCUTIO
text: phantasimes, these new tuners of accent: “By

speaker: MERCUTIO
text: Jesu, a very good blade! A very tall man! A very good

speaker: MERCUTIO
text: whore!” Why, is not this a lamentable thing, grandsire,

speaker: MERCUTIO
text: that we should be thus afflicted with these

speaker: MERCUTIO
text: strange flies, these fashion-mongers, these “pardon-me” ’s,

speaker: MERCUTIO
text: who stand so much on the new form

speaker: MERCUTIO
text: that they cannot sit at ease on the old bench? O their

speaker: MERCUTIO
text: bones, their bones!

speaker: BENVOLIO
text: Here comes Romeo, here comes Romeo.

speaker: MERCUTIO
text: Without his roe, like a dried herring. O

speaker: MERCUTIO
text: flesh, flesh, how art thou fishified! Now is he for the

speaker: MERCUTIO
text: numbers that Petrarch flowed in. Laura to his lady

speaker: MERCUTIO
text: was a kitchen wench (marry, she had a better love

speaker: MERCUTIO
text: to berhyme her), Dido a dowdy, Cleopatra a gypsy,

speaker: MERCUTIO
text: Helen and Hero hildings and harlots, Thisbe a gray

speaker: MERCUTIO
text: eye or so, but not to the purpose.—Signior Romeo,

speaker: MERCUTIO
text: bonjour. There’s a French salutation to your French

speaker: MERCUTIO
text: slop. You gave us the counterfeit fairly last night.

speaker: ROMEO
text: Good morrow to you both. What counterfeit

speaker: ROMEO
text: did I give you?

speaker: MERCUTIO
text: The slip, sir, the slip. Can you not conceive?

speaker: ROMEO
text: Pardon, good Mercutio, my business was

speaker: ROMEO
text: great, and in such a case as mine a man may strain

speaker: ROMEO
text: courtesy.

speaker: MERCUTIO
text: That’s as much as to say such a case as

speaker: MERCUTIO
text: yours constrains a man to bow in the hams.

speaker: ROMEO
text: Meaning, to curtsy.

speaker: MERCUTIO
text: Thou hast most kindly hit it.

speaker: ROMEO
text: A most courteous exposition.

speaker: MERCUTIO
text: Nay, I am the very pink of courtesy.

speaker: ROMEO
text: “Pink” for flower.

speaker: MERCUTIO
text: Right.

speaker: ROMEO
text: Why, then is my pump well flowered.

speaker: MERCUTIO
text: Sure wit, follow me this jest now till thou

speaker: MERCUTIO
text: hast worn out thy pump, that when the single sole

speaker: MERCUTIO
text: of it is worn, the jest may remain, after the wearing,

speaker: MERCUTIO
text: solely singular.

speaker: ROMEO
text: O single-soled jest, solely singular for the

speaker: ROMEO
text: singleness.

speaker: MERCUTIO
text: Come between us, good Benvolio. My wits

speaker: MERCUTIO
text: faints.

speaker: ROMEO
text: Switch and spurs, switch and spurs, or I’ll cry

speaker: ROMEO
text: a match.

speaker: MERCUTIO
text: Nay, if our wits run the wild-goose chase, I

speaker: MERCUTIO
text: am done, for thou hast more of the wild goose in

speaker: MERCUTIO
text: one of thy wits than, I am sure, I have in my whole

speaker: MERCUTIO
text: five. Was I with you there for the goose?

speaker: ROMEO
text: Thou wast never with me for anything when

speaker: ROMEO
text: thou wast not there for the goose.

speaker: MERCUTIO
text: I will bite thee by the ear for that jest.

speaker: ROMEO
text: Nay, good goose, bite not.

speaker: MERCUTIO
text: Thy wit is a very bitter sweeting; it is a most

speaker: MERCUTIO
text: sharp sauce.

speaker: ROMEO
text: And is it not, then, well served into a sweet

speaker: ROMEO
text: goose?

speaker: MERCUTIO
text: O, here’s a wit of cheveril that stretches

speaker: MERCUTIO
text: from an inch narrow to an ell broad.

speaker: ROMEO
text: I stretch it out for that word “broad,” which

speaker: ROMEO
text: added to the goose, proves thee far and wide a

speaker: ROMEO
text: broad goose.

speaker: MERCUTIO
text: Why, is not this better now than groaning

speaker: MERCUTIO
text: for love? Now art thou sociable, now art thou

speaker: MERCUTIO
text: Romeo, now art thou what thou art, by art as well as

speaker: MERCUTIO
text: by nature. For this driveling love is like a great

speaker: MERCUTIO
text: natural that runs lolling up and down to hide his

speaker: MERCUTIO
text: bauble in a hole.

speaker: BENVOLIO
text: Stop there, stop there.

speaker: MERCUTIO
text: Thou desirest me to stop in my tale against

speaker: MERCUTIO
text: the hair.

speaker: BENVOLIO
text: Thou wouldst else have made thy tale large.

speaker: MERCUTIO
text: O, thou art deceived. I would have made it

speaker: MERCUTIO
text: short, for I was come to the whole depth of my tale

speaker: MERCUTIO
text: and meant indeed to occupy the argument no

speaker: MERCUTIO
text: longer.

speaker: ROMEO
text: Here’s goodly gear. A sail, a sail!

speaker: MERCUTIO
text: Two, two—a shirt and a smock.

speaker: NURSE
text: Peter.

speaker: PETER
text: Anon.

speaker: NURSE
text: My fan, Peter.

speaker: MERCUTIO
text: Good Peter, to hide her face, for her fan’s

speaker: MERCUTIO
text: the fairer face.

speaker: NURSE
text: God you good morrow, gentlemen.

speaker: MERCUTIO
text: God you good e’en, fair gentlewoman.

speaker: NURSE
text: Is it good e’en?

speaker: MERCUTIO
text: ’Tis no less, I tell you, for the bawdy hand of

speaker: MERCUTIO
text: the dial is now upon the prick of noon.

speaker: NURSE
text: Out upon you! What a man are you?

speaker: ROMEO
text: One, gentlewoman, that God hath made, himself

speaker: ROMEO
text: to mar.

speaker: NURSE
text: By my troth, it is well said: “for himself to

speaker: NURSE
text: mar,” quoth he? Gentlemen, can any of you tell me

speaker: NURSE
text: where I may find the young Romeo?

speaker: ROMEO
text: I can tell you, but young Romeo will be older

speaker: ROMEO
text: when you have found him than he was when you

speaker: ROMEO
text: sought him. I am the youngest of that name, for

speaker: ROMEO
text: fault of a worse.

speaker: NURSE
text: You say well.

speaker: MERCUTIO
text: Yea, is the worst well? Very well took, i’

speaker: MERCUTIO
text: faith, wisely, wisely.

speaker: NURSE
text: If you be he, sir, I desire some confidence with

speaker: NURSE
text: you.

speaker: BENVOLIO
text: She will indite him to some supper.

speaker: MERCUTIO
text: A bawd, a bawd, a bawd. So ho!

speaker: ROMEO
text: What hast thou found?

speaker: MERCUTIO
text: No hare, sir, unless a hare, sir, in a Lenten

speaker: MERCUTIO
text: pie that is something stale and hoar ere it be spent.

speaker: MERCUTIO
text: Romeo, will you come to your father’s? We’ll to

speaker: MERCUTIO
text: dinner thither.

speaker: ROMEO
text: I will follow you.

speaker: MERCUTIO
text: Farewell, ancient lady. Farewell, lady, lady,

speaker: MERCUTIO
text: lady.

speaker: NURSE
text: I pray you, sir, what saucy merchant was this

speaker: NURSE
text: that was so full of his ropery?

speaker: ROMEO
text: A gentleman, nurse, that loves to hear himself

speaker: ROMEO
text: talk and will speak more in a minute than he will

speaker: ROMEO
text: stand to in a month.

speaker: NURSE
text: An he speak anything against me, I’ll take him

speaker: NURSE
text: down, an he were lustier than he is, and twenty

speaker: NURSE
text: such jacks. An if I cannot, I’ll find those that shall.

speaker: NURSE
text: Scurvy knave, I am none of his flirt-gills; I am none

speaker: NURSE
text:
of his skains-mates.
                 
                To
                 
                Peter
                .
               And thou must stand

speaker: NURSE
text: by too and suffer every knave to use me at his

speaker: NURSE
text: pleasure.

speaker: PETER
text: I saw no man use you at his pleasure. If I had,

speaker: PETER
text: my weapon should quickly have been out. I warrant

speaker: PETER
text: you, I dare draw as soon as another man, if I

speaker: PETER
text: see occasion in a good quarrel, and the law on my

speaker: PETER
text: side.

speaker: NURSE
text: Now, afore God, I am so vexed that every part

speaker: NURSE
text:
about me quivers. Scurvy knave!
                 
                To
                 
                Romeo
                .
               Pray

speaker: NURSE
text: you, sir, a word. And, as I told you, my young lady

speaker: NURSE
text: bid me inquire you out. What she bid me say, I will

speaker: NURSE
text: keep to myself. But first let me tell you, if you

speaker: NURSE
text: should lead her in a fool’s paradise, as they say, it

speaker: NURSE
text: were a very gross kind of behavior, as they say. For

speaker: NURSE
text: the gentlewoman is young; and therefore, if you

speaker: NURSE
text: should deal double with her, truly it were an ill

speaker: NURSE
text: thing to be offered to any gentlewoman, and very

speaker: NURSE
text: weak dealing.

speaker: ROMEO
text: Nurse, commend me to thy lady and mistress.

speaker: ROMEO
text: I protest unto thee—

speaker: NURSE
text: Good heart, and i’ faith I will tell her as much.

speaker: NURSE
text: Lord, Lord, she will be a joyful woman.

speaker: ROMEO
text: What wilt thou tell her, nurse? Thou dost not

speaker: ROMEO
text: mark me.

speaker: NURSE
text: I will tell her, sir, that you do protest, which, as

speaker: NURSE
text: I take it, is a gentlemanlike offer.

speaker: ROMEO
text:
Bid
               
              her
               
              devise

speaker: ROMEO
text:
Some
               
              means
               
              to
               
              come
               
              to
               
              shrift
               
              this
               
              afternoon
              ,

speaker: ROMEO
text:
And
               
              there
               
              she
               
              shall
               
              at
               
              Friar
               
              Lawrence’
               
              cell

speaker: ROMEO
text:
Be
               
              shrived
               
              and
               
              married
              .
               
              Here
               
              is
               
              for
               
              thy
               
              pains
              .

speaker: NURSE
text: No, truly, sir, not a penny.

speaker: ROMEO
text: Go to, I say you shall.

speaker: NURSE
text:
This
               
              afternoon
              ,
               
              sir
              ?
               
              Well
              ,
               
              she
               
              shall
               
              be
               
              there
              .

speaker: ROMEO
text:
And
               
              stay
              ,
               
              good
               
              nurse
              ,
               
              behind
               
              the
               
              abbey
               
              wall
              .

speaker: ROMEO
text:
Within
               
              this
               
              hour
               
              my
               
              man
               
              shall
               
              be
               
              with
               
              thee

speaker: ROMEO
text:
And
               
              bring
               
              thee
               
              cords
               
              made
               
              like
               
              a
               
              tackled
               
              stair
              ,

speaker: ROMEO
text:
Which
               
              to
               
              the
               
              high
               
              topgallant
               
              of
               
              my
               
              joy

speaker: ROMEO
text:
Must
               
              be
               
              my
               
              convoy
               
              in
               
              the
               
              secret
               
              night
              .

speaker: ROMEO
text:
Farewell
              .
               
              Be
               
              trusty
              ,
               
              and
               
              I’ll
               
              quit
               
              thy
               
              pains
              .

speaker: ROMEO
text:
Farewell
              .
               
              Commend
               
              me
               
              to
               
              thy
               
              mistress
              .

speaker: NURSE
text:
Now
              ,
               
              God
               
              in
               
              heaven
               
              bless
               
              thee
              !
               
              Hark
               
              you
              ,
               
              sir
              .

speaker: ROMEO
text:
What
               
              sayst
               
              thou
              ,
               
              my
               
              dear
               
              nurse
              ?

speaker: NURSE
text:
Is
               
              your
               
              man
               
              secret
              ?
               
              Did
               
              you
               
              ne’er
               
              hear
               
              say

speaker: NURSE
text:
“
              Two
               
              may
               
              keep
               
              counsel
              ,
               
              putting
               
              one
               
              away
              ”
              ?

speaker: ROMEO
text:
Warrant
               
              thee
              ,
               
              my
               
              man’s
               
              as
               
              true
               
              as
               
              steel
              .

speaker: NURSE
text: Well, sir, my mistress is the sweetest lady. Lord,

speaker: NURSE
text: Lord, when ’twas a little prating thing—O, there is

speaker: NURSE
text: a nobleman in town, one Paris, that would fain lay

speaker: NURSE
text: knife aboard, but she, good soul, had as lief see a

speaker: NURSE
text: toad, a very toad, as see him. I anger her sometimes

speaker: NURSE
text: and tell her that Paris is the properer man, but I’ll

speaker: NURSE
text: warrant you, when I say so, she looks as pale as any

speaker: NURSE
text: clout in the versal world. Doth not rosemary and

speaker: NURSE
text: Romeo begin both with a letter?

speaker: ROMEO
text: Ay, nurse, what of that? Both with an R.

speaker: NURSE
text: Ah, mocker, that’s the dog’s name. R is for

speaker: NURSE
text: the—No, I know it begins with some other letter,

speaker: NURSE
text: and she hath the prettiest sententious of it, of you

speaker: NURSE
text: and rosemary, that it would do you good to hear it.

speaker: ROMEO
text: Commend me to thy lady.

speaker: NURSE
text: Ay, a thousand times.—Peter.

speaker: PETER
text: Anon.

speaker: NURSE
text: Before and apace.
